page.title: 03MACHINE PEAT CUTTING IN EDAY
page.content: Recently the local shop has started to cut peat by machine on a commercial basis. Before the peat can be cut by machine the heather must be burnt off the top. Then it is left for one or two weeks before the machine can start to cut. The machine that cuts the peat is pulled along behind a tractor. It has a sharp metal disc which cuts the peat which is then compressed and the machine drops them on top of the ground where they are left to dry for about three weeks. When dry the peats are put into sacks and either delivered to houses locally or exported to other islands or the mainland of Orkney. The peats that are cut by machine are shaped like long thick sausages.
